subject: Sales
title: Neil Rackham and SPIN Selling
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Neil Rackham and SPIN Selling.

hook.text: Most sales advice came from gut instinct. Neil Rackham studied 35,000 real sales calls instead.

buildup.text: He discovered that top performers asked better questions. Great questions drove great deals.

discovery.text: SPIN: Situation, Problem, Implication, Need-payoff. Four question types that consistently sell.

twist.text: Rackham proved classic hard-closing actually hurts complex sales. Pushiness backfired with data.

climax.text: His research transformed B2B selling forever. Data replaced instinct as the sales foundation.

punchline.text: He replaced guesswork with science. Sales got smarter.

quiz.question: What does SPIN stand for in SPIN Selling?
